Posted By: 2pcsofcandy (7/8/2011 4:25:50 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@BonniePrinceCharlie  
Read the flavour text from Ravnica version:  
'Long ago, birds of paradise littered the skies. Thanks to the city's sprawl, most now exist as pets of society's elite.'  
And if you'd read the story, plane Ravnica wasn't covered in city since beginning. There was lots of nature&stuff. It was in Gruul's duty to protect the outlands and nature, but because city spread over every last inch of land, there wasn't any nature to protect and Gruul became group of gangs and raiding packs, unlike it's old function. So in short: Ravnica wasn't all city from beginning and that's why there were birds.
posts.html:
@BonniePrinceCharlie
Read the flavour text from Ravnica version:
'Long ago, birds of paradise littered the skies. Thanks to the city's sprawl, most now exist as pets of society's elite.'
And if you'd read the story, plane Ravnica wasn't covered in city since beginning. There was lots of nature&stuff. Posted By: Shadoflaam (7/7/2011 6:33:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Endomarru  
  
Wizards has realized that there is only one bird in the art, and they are going to fix that in the next core set. How, you ask? Well, the name "Birds of Paradise" is confusing when there is only one bird, and the name is also bland and is not high-fantasy, like all creatures should be. Birds? No no no, Wizards is going to create an entirely new bird that is completely different and redefines the identity of what a fantastic bird should be! No longer shall an ordinary bird be the measure of a 0/1 flier! Behold, the new face of Magic:  
  
**Runeclaw Bird** {G}  
Creature - Bird  
Flying  
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.  
*Birds aren't always as vibrant and feathery as you imagine. Some are even vibranter and featheryer.*  
0/1

Birds aren't always as vibrant and feathery as you imagine. Some are even vibranter and featheryer.
